intro: Lagetta valenzuelana, commonly known as the Valenzuelan bellflower, is a perennial herb native to Mexico. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lanceolate and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
